title: Number of working mothers rises to record high, as ONS figures show 75% of them now have jobs
text:
The number of working mothers has risen to a record high, as government figures show three quarters of them now have jobs.

The Office for National Statistics (ONS) today published data on families and the labour market.

The figures revealed that the number of mothers in the labour market has grown substantially over the last 20 years, with 66.2% of mothers in employment in 2000. However by 2019, that figure rose to 75.1%.

Meanwhile, the number of fathers in the labour market has also changed over the last two decades. They increased from 89.4% of fathers in 2000 to 92.6% in 2019.

Maxine Benson MBE, co-founder of Everywoman, an organisation which helps support the advancement of women in business, said that the statistics show great progress for mothers in the workplace, but warned there are still plenty of existing “barriers”.
